intro: Erigeron accedens, commonly known as the Mexican blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun, making it well adapted to arid environments. Its blue to violet flowers bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Erigeron accedens is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements and ornamental value.
